intro: Calotis moorei, commonly known as the Moore's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, typical of the genus Calotis. It is a low-growing herb that thrives in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Calotis moorei is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
